sentence.Network_en: From the chiffonier had gone the knick - knacks of silver and plate.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from French chiffonnier, chiffonnière, literally 'ragpicker', also denoting a chest of drawers for odds and ends

means.word_mean: 1. a tall elegant chest of drawers

auth_sentence.content: I was crouched beneath the chiffonier, beside her feet: black high heels, stockings a color that made her skin look powdered.
